abstract.p: New York Rangers coach Glen Sather says he is happy with right wing Anson Carter's three goals in six games (S)

block.p: Since Rangers Coach Glen Sather publicly criticized right wing Anson Carter on Nov. 18, saying his play was uninspired, Carter has three goals and an assist in six games.

Since Carter voiced his displeasure last Sunday at being scratched for the second straight game, ostensibly because of a sore right wrist, he has scored a goal in consecutive games heading into tonight's contest against the Tampa Bay Lightning at Madison Square Garden.

Coincidence? Carter thinks so. Sather thinks not.
Yesterday, in a telephone interview, Sather said that Carter, who is making $2.8 million this season, is playing ''much better'' since he was criticized.
''That's what coaches do,'' Sather said. ''It's not our job to be the player's best friend. You always want to encourage guys. But sometimes they need a little push.''

On Thursday, when it was pointed out to Carter that Sather probably felt there was cause and effect between the criticism and his revived play, Carter said: ''That's just Slats being the coach. If I was the coach, I'd probably feel the same way.''
